snippet: Ai Weiwei, the rebel artist, said Tuesday that a court in Beijing had agreed to hear his lawsuit against the city’s tax authorities.
abstract: Chinese dissident artist Ai Weiwei announces that a court in Beijing has agreed to hear his lawsuit against the city's tax authorities. (S)
lead_paragraph: Ai Weiwei, the rebel artist, said Tuesday that a court in Beijing had agreed to hear his lawsuit against the city's tax authorities. Mr. Ai is suing the officials for bringing a tax case against him. Tax officials have said Mr. Ai's company, Beijing Fake Cultural Development, owes the equivalent of $2.4 million in back taxes and penalties. Mr. Ai said he did not owe that amount and has argued that his wife, Lu Qing, is formally in charge of the company. Mr. Ai was detained for 81 days last year and has continued to mock the Chinese government and the Communist Party since his release.

headline.main: China: Court to Hear Artist's Lawsuit
